newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian metals prices mixed in dull trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian metals prices mixed in dull trade.

text.p: Indian copper and nickel prices lifted further on the metal market, dealers said.
Other base metals however remained quiet amid dull trading.
Ready copper rose by 50 rupees to 13,000 rupees per quintal on restricted arrivals and fresh industrial support. Copper was up by 100 rupees per quintal on Monday.
"The price hike of 4,000/9,000 rupees per tonne announced by the state-owned Hindustan Copper Ltd on Monday also helped an uptrend in the Bombay market," one dealer said.

Nickel rose by 100 rupees to 37,000 per quintal on the back of continued speculative buying after an upsurge in the world market. Physical interest remained at low ebb. Nickel was up by 100 rupees on Monday and by 300 rupees during last week.
Aluminium remained quiet at 7,250 rupees per quintal, zinc at 6,900 rupees and lead to 4,550 per quintal amid nominal trading.
